classRec.name: DateTimeParser
classRec.description:
A set of static functions to parse the time and date values. All date related methods are the UTC versions.

Also methods for handling legacy format are available

method.name: date2string
method.description: Convert a Date object to a string, CCYY-MM-DD

method.name: dateTime2string
method.description: Convert a Date object to a string CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss]TZD
method.param: ms Include milliseconds in the resulting string

method.name: legacyString2dateTime
method.description: Convert a legacy string CCYYMMDDThh:mm:ss to a Date object

method.name: legacyString2date
method.description: Convert a lecagy string CCYYMMDD to a Date object.

method.name: string2dateTime
method.description: Convert a string CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss]TZD to a Date object

method.name: string2date
method.description: Convert a string CCYY-MM-DD to a date object

method.name: string2time
method.description: Convert a string hh:mm:ss[.sss][TZD] to a Date object

method.name: time2string
method.description: Convert a Date object to a string hh:mm:ss[.sss][TZD]
method.param: ms Include milliseconds in the resulting string

Stream Compression - Native DEFLATE

All multi-byte numbers in the format described in RFC 1950 are stored with the MOST-significant byte first (at the lower memory address).

classRec.description: Formatted name pronunciation property.

method.name: VCardSound
method.description: To save a sound, either phonetic, binaryValue or externalValue are required.
method.param: binaryValue The BASE64 encoded binary value of the audio pronunciation.
externalValue The URI to an external binary digital audio pronunciation.

classRec.name: VCardOrganization
classRec.description: Organizational name and unit.

classRec.name: VCardName
classRec.description: Structured name.

classRec.name: VCardGeographicalPosition
classRec.description: Geographical position.

classRec.name: VCardPhoto
classRec.description:
Photograph.

The image height and width SHOULD be between thirty-two (32) and ninety-six (96) pixels; the recommended size is sixty-four (64) pixels high and sixty-four (64) pixels wide.

The image SHOULD be square.

method.name: VCardPhoto
method.description: To save a photo, either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both. If binaryValue is passed in, type is required. If externalValue is passed in, type is not required.
method.param: type The image type of the photo. Required if binaryValue is passed in.
binaryValue The BASE64 encoded binary value of the photo. Either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both.
externalValue The URI to an external photo. Either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both.

method.name: binaryValue
method.description:
Base64 encoded data. The image SHOULD use less than eight kilobytes (8k) of data; this restriction is to be enforced by the publishing client.

The image data MUST conform to the base64Binary datatype [7] and thus be encoded in accordance with Section 6.8 of RFC 2045 [8], which recommends that base64 data should have lines limited to at most 76 characters in length. However, any whitespace characters (e.g., '\\r' and '\\n') MUST be ignored.

method.name: bytes
method.description: Image data

method.name: externalValue
method.description: The URI to an external photo

method.name: type
method.description:
Mimetype of the given bytes value, if any. Should be set by hand.

The image content type [6] SHOULD be image/gif, image/jpeg, or image/png; support for the "image/png" content type is REQUIRED, support for the "image/gif" and "image/jpeg" content types is RECOMMENDED, and support for any other content type is OPTIONAL.

classRec.name: VCard
classRec.description:
VCard updates in 2010:

New vCard data classes to encompass similar properties:

  • VCardAddress (country, extendedAddress, locality, poBox, postalCode, region, street)
  • VCardGeographicalPosition (latitude, longitude)
  • VCardName (family, given, middle, prefix, suffix)
  • VCardOrganization (name, unit)
  • VCardPhoto (binaryValue, bytes, externalValue, type)
  • VCardSound (binaryValue, bytes, externalValue, phonetic)
  • VCardTelephone (cell, fax, msg, pager, video, voice)

TODO: The only properties not yet implemented from the spec: agent, categories, key

classRec.name: XMLRPC
classRec.description: Implements client side XML marshalling of methods and parameters into XMLRPC.

method.name: findNode
method.description: Find an element that has the given name within and including the candidate XML.

method.name: fromXML
method.description: Extract and marshall the XML-RPC response to Flash types.
method.param: xml The XML containing the message response
method.return: Mixed object of either an array of results from the method call or a fault. If the result is a fault, "result.isFault" will evaulate as true.

method.name: toXML
method.description: The marshalling process, accepting a block of XML, a string description of the remote method, and an array of flash type parameters.
method.return: XML containing the XML marshalled result

classRec.name: RPCExtension
classRec.description:
Implements XEP-0009 for XML-RPC over XMPP.

The protocol supports all syntax and semantics of XML-RPC except that it uses XMPP instead of HTTP as the underlying transport.

method.name: RPCExtension
method.param: parent (Optional) The containing XML for this extension

method.name: call
method.description: Place the remote call. This method serializes the remote procedure call to XML. The call will be made on the remote machine when the stanza containing this extension is sent to the server. If this extension is being returned, then check the result property instead.
method.param: methodName The name of the remote procedure to call
params A collection of parameters of any type

method.name: getElementName
method.description: Interface method, returning the namespace for this extension

method.name: getNS
method.description: Interface method, returning the namespace for this extension

method.name: faultCode
method.description: A common result from most RPC servers to describe a fault

method.name: faultString
method.description: A common result from most RPC servers to describe a fault

method.name: fault
method.description: The object containing the fault of the remote procedure call. This object could have any properties, as fault results are only structurally defined.

method.name: isFault
method.description: Check this if property if you wish to determine the remote procedure call produced an error. If the XMPP stanza never made it to the RPC service, then the error would be on the stanza object instead of this extension.
method.return: True if the remote procedure call produced an error

method.name: result
method.description: The result of this remote procedure call. It can contain elements of any type.
method.return: Array of demarshalled results from the remote procedure

method.name: xml
method.description: Interface method, returning the namespace for this extension

classRec.name: InviteListener
classRec.description:
Manages the dispatching of events during invitations. Add event listeners to an instance of this class to monitor invite and decline events.

You only need a single instance of this class to listen for all invite or decline events.

Event.name: invited
Event.description: Dispatched when an invitations has been received.

method.name: InviteListener
method.param: aConnection An XMPPConnection instance that is providing the primary server connection.

method.name: connection
method.description: A reference to the XMPPConnection being used for incoming/outgoing XMPP data.

classRec.name: Room
classRec.description: Manages incoming and outgoing data from a conference room as part of multi-user conferencing (XEP-0045). You will need an instance of this class for each room that the user joins.

Event.name: userPresenceChange
Event.description: Dispatched when a user's presence changes.

Event.name: userKicked
Event.description: Dispatched when a user is kicked from the room.

Event.name: userJoin
Event.description: Dispatched whenever an occupant joins the room. The RoomEvent instance will contain an attribute nickname with the nickname of the occupant who joined.

Event.name: userDeparture
Event.description: Dispatched whenever an occpant leaves the room. The RoomEvent instance will contain an attribute nickname with the nickname of the occupant who left.

Event.name: userBanned
Event.description: Dispatched when a user is banned from the room.

Event.name: subjectChange
Event.description: Dispatched when the room subject changes.

Event.name: roomLeave
Event.description: Dispatched when the server acknoledges that you have the left the room.

Event.name: roomJoin
Event.description: Dispatched when you have entered the room and messages that are sent will be displayed to other users. The room's role and affiliation will be visible from this point forward.

Event.name: roomDestroyed
Event.description: Dispatched when the room is removed.

Event.name: registrationReqError
Event.description: Dispatched when the room is members-only and the user is not on the member list.

Event.name: privateMessage
Event.description: Dispatched whenever a new private message is received. The RoomEvent class contains an attribute data with the private message as an instance of the Message class.

Event.name: passwordError
Event.description: Dispatched when the room requires a password and the user did not supply one (or the password provided is incorrect).

Event.name: nickConflict
Event.description: Dispatched when the user's preferred nickname already exists in the room. The RoomEvent will contain an attribute nickname with the nickname already existing in the room.

Event.name: maxUsersError
Event.description: Dispatched if the room has reached its maximum number of occupants.

Event.name: lockedError
Event.description: Dispatched if a user attempts to enter a room while it is "locked" (i.e., before the room creator provides an initial configuration and therefore before the room officially exists).

Event.name: groupMessage
Event.description: Dispatched whenever a new message intented for all room occupants is received. The RoomEvent class will contain an attribute data with the group message as an instance of the Message class.

Event.name: declined
Event.description:
Dispatched when an invite to this room has been declined by the invitee. The RoomEvent data property that has the following attributes:

from: The JID of the user initiating the invite
reason: A string containing the reason to join the room
data: The original message containing the decline

Event.name: configureRoomComplete
Event.description: Dispatched when a room configuration form is complete.

Event.name: configureRoom
Event.description:
Dispatched when a room configuration form is required. This can occur during the creation of a room, or if a room configuration is requested. The RoomEvent instance will contain an attribute data that is an instance of an object with the following attributes:

instructions: Instructions for the use of form
title: Title of the configuration form
label: A friendly name for the field
name: A computer readable identifier for the field used to identify this field in the result passed to configure()
type: The type of the field to be displayed. Type will be a constant from the FormField class.

Event.name: bannedError
Event.description: Dispatched if the user attempted to join the room but was not allowed to do so because they are banned (i.e., has an affiliation of "outcast").

Event.name: affiliations
Event.description:
Dispatched when an affiliation list has been requested. The event object contains an array of MUCItems containing the JID and affiliation properties.

To grant or revoke permissions based on this list, only send the changes you wish to make, calling grant/revoke with the new affiliation and existing JID.

Event.name: affiliationChangeComplete
Event.description: Dispatched when an affiliation change has completed.

Event.name: adminError
Event.description: Dispatched when an administration action failed.

Event.name: change
Event.description: Dispatched when the active, affiliation, or role property changes.

method.name: Room
method.param: aConnection A XMPPConnection instance that is providing the primary server connection

method.name: allow
method.description:
Allow a previously banned JIDs to enter this room. This is the same as: Room.grant(AFFILIATION_NONE, jid)

If the process could not be completed, the room will dispatch the event RoomEvent.ADMIN_ERROR
method.param: jids An array of unescaped JIDs to allow

method.name: ban
method.description:
Bans an array of JIDs from entering the room.

If the process could not be completed, the room will dispatch the event RoomEvent.ADMIN_ERROR.
method.param: jids An arry of unescaped JIDs to ban

method.name: cancelConfiguration
method.description:
Cancels the configuration process. The room may still be locked if you cancel the configuration process when attempting to join a reserved room.

You must have joined the room and have the owner affiliation to configure the room.

method.name: changeSubject
method.description: Changes the subject in the conference room. You must have already joined the room before you can change the subject.

method.name: configure
method.description: Sends a configuration form to the room. You must be joined and have owner affiliation to configure the room
method.param: fieldmap FormExtension, or a hash that is an object with keys being the room configuration form variables and the values being arrays. For single value fields, use a single element array.

method.name: decline
method.description:
Actively decline an invitation. You can optionally ignore invitations but if you choose to decline an invitation, you call this method on a room instance that represents the room the invite originated from.

You do not need to have joined this room to decline an invitation

Note: mu-conference-0.6 does not allow users to send decline messages without joining first. If using this version of conferencing software, it is best to ignore invites.
method.param: jid An unescaped JID of the user to invite.
reason A string describing why the invitiation was declined

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroys a reserved room. If the room has been configured to be persistent, then it is optional that the server will permanently remove the room.
method.param: reason A short description of why the room is being destroyed
alternateJID A JID for current members to use as an alternate room to join after the room has been destroyed. Like a postal forwarding address.

method.name: dispatchChangeEvent
method.description: Helper to dispatch a property change event.

method.name: getMessage
method.description: Gets an instance of the Message class that has been pre-configured to be sent from this room. Use this method to get a Message in order to add extensions to outgoing room messages.
method.param: htmlBody The message body with HTML formatting

method.name: getOccupantNamed
method.description: Gets the RoomOccupant whose nickname matches the name passed in.

method.name: grant
method.description:
Grants permissions on a room to one or more JIDs by setting the affiliation of a user based on their JID.

If the JID currently has an existing affiliation, then the existing affiliation will be replaced with the one passed. If the process could not be completed, the room will dispatch the event RoomEvent.ADMIN_ERROR.

XMPP spec states that the #admin schema should be used for affiliation changes. Unfortunately to this date, Openfire does not match spec and requires the #owner schema. Because of this, if granting privileges fails on the first attempt using the #admin schema, we try again using the #owner schema.
method.param: affiliation Use one of the following affiliations: Room.AFFILIATION_MEMBER, Room.AFFILIATION_ADMIN, Room.AFFILIATION_OWNER
jids An array of UnescapedJIDs to grant these permissions to

method.name: invite
method.description:
Invites a user that is not currently a member of this room to this room.

You must have joined the room and have appropriate permissions to invite other memebers, because the server will format and send the invite message to as if it came from the room rather that you sending the invite directly from you.

To listen to invite events, add an event listener on your XMPPConnection to the InviteEvent.INVITED event.
method.param: jid An unescaped JID of the user to invite.
reason A string describing why you would like to invite the user.

method.name: isThisRoom
method.description: Determines if the sender parameter is the same as the room's JID.
method.return: true if the passed JID matches the getRoomJID

method.name: isThisUser
method.description: Determines if the sender param is the same as the user's JID.
method.param: sender the room JID to test
method.return: true if the passed JID matches the userJID

method.name: joinWithExplicitMUCExtension
method.description:
Joins a conference room based on the parameters specified by the room properties. This call will create an instant room based on a default server configuration if the room doesn't exist.

To create and begin the configuration process of a reserved room, pass true to this method to begin the configuration process. When The configuration is complete, the room will be unlocked for others to join. Listen for the RoomEvent.CONFIGURE_ROOM event to handle and either return or cancel the configuration of the room.

This function adds an additional parameter to allow the caller to completely customize the MUC extension that gets sent to the room. For example, you can add a history element that specifies how much discussion history you want sent when you join the room (http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0045.html#enter-managehistory): var muc:MUCExtension = new MUCExtension(); muc.history = true; muc.maxchars = 0; _room.joinWithExplicitMUCExtension(false, mucExt);
method.param: createReserved Set to true if you wish to create and configure a reserved room
mucExtension The customized MUC extension to send with initial presence to the room.
joinPresenceExtensions An array of additional extensions to send with the initial presence to the room.
method.return: A boolean indicating whether the join attempt was successfully sent.

method.name: join
method.description:
Joins a conference room based on the parameters specified by the room properties. This call will create an instant room based on a default server configuration if the room doesn't exist.

To create and begin the configuration process of a reserved room, pass true to this method to begin the configuration process. When The configuration is complete, the room will be unlocked for others to join. Listen for the RoomEvent.CONFIGURE_ROOM event to handle and either return or cancel the configuration of the room.
method.param: createReserved Set to true if you wish to create and configure a reserved room
joinPresenceExtensions An array of additional extensions to send with the initial presence to the room.
method.return: A boolean indicating whether the join attempt was successfully sent.

method.name: kickOccupant
method.description: Kicks an occupant out of the room, assuming that the user has necessary permissions in order to do so. If the user does not, the server will return an error.
method.param: occupantNick The nickname of the room occupant to kick
reason The reason for the kick

method.name: leave
method.description: Leaves the current conference room, assuming that the user has joined one. If the user is not currently in a room, this method does nothing.

method.name: requestAffiliations
method.description: Requests an affiliation list for a given affiliation with with room. This will either dispatch the event RoomEvent.AFFILIATIONS or RoomEvent.ADMIN_ERROR depending on the result of the request.
method.param: affiliation Use one of the following affiliations: Room.AFFILIATION_NONE, Room.AFFILIATION_OUTCAST, Room.AFFILIATION_MEMBER, Room.AFFILIATION_ADMIN, Room.AFFILIATION_OWNER

method.name: requestConfiguration
method.description: Requests a configuration form from the room. Listen to configureRoom event to fill out the form then call either configure or cancelConfiguration to complete the configuration process You must be joined to the room and have the owner affiliation to request a configuration form

method.name: revoke
method.description:
Revokes all affiliations from the JIDs. This is the same as: grant( Room.AFFILIATION_NONE, jids )

If the process could not be completed, the room will dispatch the event RoomEvent.ADMIN_ERROR. Note: if the JID is banned from this room, then this will also revoke the banned status.
method.param: jids An array of UnescapedJIDs to revoke affiliations from

method.name: sendMessageWithExtension
method.description: Sends a message to the conference room with an extension attached. Use this method in conjunction with the getMessage method.

method.name: sendMessage
method.description: Sends a message to the conference room.
method.param: htmlBody The message body with HTML formatting

method.name: sendPrivateMessage
method.description: Sends a private message to a specific participant in the conference room.
method.param: recipientNickname The conference room nickname of the recipient who should receive the private message
htmlBody The message body with HTML formatting

method.name: setActive
method.description: Needs to be available only within this class

method.name: setOccupantVoice
method.description: In a moderated room, sets voice status to a particular occupant, assuming the user has the necessary permissions to do so.
method.param: occupantNick The nickname of the occupant to give voice
voice Whether to add voice (true) or remove voice (false). Having voice means that the user is actually able to talk. Without voice the user is effectively muted.

method.name: active
method.description: Determines whether the connection to the room is active - that is, the user is connected and has joined the room.

method.name: affiliation
method.description: Gets the user's affiliation for this room. Possible affiliations are "owner", "admin", "member", and "outcast". It is also possible to have no defined affiliation.

method.name: anonymous
method.description: Whether the room shows full JIDs or not.

method.name: conferenceServer
method.description: The conference server to use for this room. Usually, this is a subdomain of the primary XMPP server, like conference.myserver.com.

method.name: connection
method.description: A reference to the XMPPConnection being used for incoming/outgoing XMPP data.

method.name: nickname
method.description: The nickname to use when joining.

method.name: password
method.description: The password.

method.name: role
method.description:
Gets the user's role in the conference room.

Possible roles are "visitor", "participant", "moderator" or no defined role.

  • ROLE_MODERATOR
  • ROLE_NONE
  • ROLE_PARTICIPANT
  • ROLE_VISITOR

method.name: roomJID
method.description: The unescaped JID of the room. room@conference.server Set this after initiating a new Room.

method.name: roomName
method.description: The room name that should be used when joining.

method.name: subject
method.description: The subject.

method.name: userJID
method.description: Get the JID of the conference room user.

classRec.name: ExtensionClassRegistry
classRec.description: This is a static class that contains class constructors for all extensions that could come from the network.

method.name: getNamespaces
method.description: Get a list of namespaces of the currently enabled extensions.

method.name: lookup
method.description: Find the extension with the given NS and ELEMENT_NAME if availale in the registery.
method.param: elementName Optional ELEMENT_NAME, used if there are several extensions with the same NS

method.name: register
method.description: Registers the given extension with the extension registry for it to be used, in case incoming data matches its ELEMENT_NAME and NS.
method.return: In case the Extension was already added or it was not proper type, returns false.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove the given extension from the registery.

field.name: _classes
field.description: Array of the Extension classes.

interfaceRec.name: INodeProxy
interfaceRec.description:
An interface for objects that abstract XML data by providing accessors to the original XML data stored within.

Most XMPP stanzas that will interact with the library should implement this interface.

interfaceRec.name: IExtension
interfaceRec.description: The interface describing an extension. All extensions must implement this interface.

method.name: getElementName
method.description: Element name of the extension

method.name: getNS
method.description: Namespace of the element

interfaceRec.name: IExtendable
interfaceRec.description: This interface provides access to contained extensions and methods to modify the contained extensions. All XMPP stanzas that can be extended should implement this interface.

interfaceRec.name: IXMLStanza
interfaceRec.description: Since XML migration, the only job for this interace is to bring together two other interfaces that it extends.

classRec.name: ExtensionContainer
classRec.description: Contains the implementation for a generic extension container. Use the static method "decorate" to implement the IExtendable interface on a class.

method.name: addExtension
method.description: Add extension to the list of the given namespace and insert to the XML element as a child.
method.return: The same IExtension that was passed via the parameter

method.name: getExtension
method.description: Get the extension having the given element name. Unfortunetly only takes the oldest of the list...

method.name: xml
method.description:
The XML node that should be used for this stanza's internal XML representation, base of the XMLStanza, XML element.

Simply by setting this will take care of the required parsing and deserialisation.

field.name: _exts
field.description: From ExtensionContainer { NS: [ Extension, Extension, ... ], ... }

field.name: _xml
field.description: The XML.

classRec.name: XMLStanza
classRec.description: This is a base class for all classes that encapsulate XML stanza data. It provides a set of methods that faciliate easy manipulation of XML data.

method.name: XMLStanza
method.description: XMPP is based on communication with XML stanzas

method.name: getAttribute
method.description: Convinience method for getting element value from the XML.

method.name: getChildAttribute
method.description: Convinience method for getting child element attribute value from the XML.

method.name: getChildField
method.description:
Convinience method for getting child element value from the XML.

Might seem over complex, but AS3 seems to handle different kind of XML differently, thus shorthands and even methods such as localName() do not work as expected.

method.name: getField
method.description:
Convinience method for getting element value from the XML.

Might seem over complex, but AS3 seems to handle different kind of XML differently, thus shorthands and even methods such as localName() do not work as expected.

method.name: removeFields
method.description: Helper method for removing all child elements that have the given name.

method.name: setAttribute
method.description: Convinience method for setting a value to a element in the XML.

method.name: setChildAttribute
method.description:
Convinience method for setting an attribute for a child element of the XML.

In case the child element does not exist, it will be created.

method.name: setChildField
method.description: Convinience method for setting a value for a child element of the XML.

method.name: setField
method.description: Convinience method for setting a value to a element in the XML.

method.name: toString
method.description: Converts the base stanza XML to a string.
method.return: The base XML in string form, as in toXMLString()

field.name: DEFAULT_NS
field.description: Default XML namespace. Must define in AS3.

classRec.name: XMPPStanza
classRec.description:
The base class for all XMPP stanza data classes.

Three types can exist:

  • message
  • presence
  • iq

method.name: XMPPStanza
method.description:
The following four first attributes are common to message, presence, and IQ stanzas. The fifth, xml:lang, is not included here.

RFC 3920: 9. XML Stanzas

After TLS negotiation (Section 5) if desired, SASL negotiation (Section 6), and Resource Binding (Section 7) if necessary, XML stanzas can be sent over the streams. Three kinds of XML stanza are defined for the 'jabber:client' and 'jabber:server' namespaces: >message/<, >presence/<, and >iq/<. In addition, there are five common attributes for these kinds of stanza. These common attributes, as well as the basic semantics of the three stanza kinds, are defined herein; more detailed information regarding the syntax of XML stanzas in relation to instant messaging and presence applications is provided in [XMPP-IM].

		           |  initiating to receiving  |  receiving to initiating
		  ---------+---------------------------+-----------------------
		  to       |  hostname of receiver     |  silently ignored
		  from     |  silently ignored         |  hostname of receiver
		  id       |  silently ignored         |  session key
		  xml:lang |  default language         |  default language
		  version  |  signals XMPP 1.0 support |  signals XMPP 1.0 support
method.param: nodeName One of the four ELEMENT_constants

method.name: generateID
method.description: Generates a unique ID for the stanza. ID generation is handled using a variety of mechanisms, but the default for the library uses the IncrementalGenerator.
method.param: prefix The prefix for the ID to be generated

method.name: delayedDelivery
method.description:
Time of the message/presence in case of a delay. Used only for messages which were sent while user was offline.

Can be set only via XML as the value should come from the server.

There are two ways that might be possible coming from the server, XEP-0203 or XEP-0091, of which the latter is legacy.

XEP-0203: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss]TZD

XEP-0091: CCYYMMDDThh:mm:ss

method.name: errorCode
method.description:
The error code, assuming this stanza contains error information. Error codes are deprecated in standard XMPP, but they are commonly used by older Jabber servers like Jabberd 1.4.

Use NaN to remove.

See the link for XEP-0086: Error Condition Mappings

method.name: errorCondition
method.description:
The error condition, assuming this stanza contains error information.

Use null to remove.

Error condition should be in lowercase and not contain any whitespace.

Error element must be qualified by urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas namespace.
method.see: http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0086.html TODO: Conform spec... find examples

method.name: errorMessage
method.description:
The error message, assuming this stanza contains error information.

Use null to remove.

This is the text element that is a child of error element.

method.name: errorType
method.description:
The error type, assuming this stanza contains error information.

Use null to remove.

The value of the error element's 'type' attribute MUST be one of the following:

  • cancel -- do not retry (the error is unrecoverable)
  • continue -- proceed (the condition was only a warning)
  • modify -- retry after changing the data sent
  • auth -- retry after providing credentials
  • wait -- retry after waiting (the error is temporary)

method.name: from
method.description:
The JID of the sender. Most, if not all, server implementations follow the specifications that prevent this from being falsified. Thus, under normal circumstances, you don't need to supply this information because the server will fill it in automatically.

Use null to remove.

method.name: idGenerator
method.description:
The ID generator for this stanza type.

ID generators must implement the IIDGenerator interface. The XIFF library comes with a few default ID generators that have already been implemented (see org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id..

Setting the ID generator by stanza type is useful if you'd like to use different ID generation schemes for each type. For instance, messages could use the incremental ID generation scheme provided by the IncrementalGenerator class, while IQs could use the shared object ID generation scheme provided by the SOIncrementalGenerator class.
method.example:
The following sets the ID generator for the Message stanza type to an IncrementalGenerator found in org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id.IncrementalGenerator: 
Message.idGenerator = new IncrementalGenerator();

method.name: id
method.description:
The unique identifier of this stanza. ID generation is accomplished using the static generateID method of the particular stanza type.

RFC: The optional 'id' attribute MAY be used by a sending entity for internal tracking of stanzas that it sends and receives (especially for tracking the request-response interaction inherent in the semantics of IQ stanzas). It is OPTIONAL for the value of the 'id' attribute to be unique globally, within a domain, or within a stream. The semantics of IQ stanzas impose additional restrictions; see IQ Semantics (Section 9.2.3).

Use null to remove.

method.name: to
method.description:
The JID of the recipient.

Use null to remove.

method.name: type
method.description:
The stanza type. There are MANY types available, depending on what kind of stanza this is.

The XIFF Library defines the types for IQ, Presence, and Message in each respective class as static string variables. Below is a listing of each:

IQ
  • IQ.TYPE_ERROR
  • IQ.TYPE_GET
  • IQ.TYPE_RESULT
  • IQ.TYPE_SET
Presence
  • Presence.TYPE_ERROR
  • Presence.TYPE_PROBE
  • Presence.TYPE_SUBSCRIBE
  • Presence.TYPE_SUBSCRIBED
  • Presence.TYPE_UNAVAILABLE
  • Presence.TYPE_UNSUBSCRIBE
  • Presence.TYPE_UNSUBSCRIBED
Message
  • Message.TYPE_CHAT
  • Message.TYPE_ERROR
  • Message.TYPE_GROUPCHAT
  • Message.TYPE_HEADLINE
  • Message.TYPE_NORMAL

Use null to remove.

RFC: The 'type' attribute specifies detailed information about the purpose or context of the message, presence, or IQ stanza. The particular allowable values for the 'type' attribute vary depending on whether the stanza is a message, presence, or IQ; the values for message and presence stanzas are specific to instant messaging and presence applications and therefore are defined in [XMPP-IM], whereas the values for IQ stanzas specify the role of an IQ stanza in a structured request-response "conversation" and thus are defined under IQ Semantics (Section 9.2.3) below. The only 'type' value common to all three stanzas is "error"; see Stanza Errors (Section 9.3).

method.name: xml
method.description: In addition to saving the XML, check for possible Extensions that are registered for listening this XML data.

field.name: CLIENT_VERSION
field.description: The version of XMPP specified in RFC 3920 is "1.0"; in particular, this encapsulates the stream-related protocols (Use of TLS (Section 5), Use of SASL (Section 6), and Stream Errors (Section 4.7)), as well as the semantics of the three defined XML stanza types (message, presence, and iq).

field.name: ELEMENT_TEMP
field.description: Internal name in XIFF for incoming data. The proper element name should be available after setting the XML.

field.name: ERROR_AUTH
field.description: Retry after providing credentials

field.name: ERROR_CANCEL
field.description: Do not retry (the error is unrecoverable)

field.name: ERROR_CONTINUE
field.description: Proceed (the condition was only a warning)

field.name: ERROR_MODIFY
field.description: Retry after changing the data sent

field.name: ERROR_WAIT
field.description: Retry after waiting (the error is temporary)

classRec.name: Extension
classRec.description: This is a base class for all data extensions.

method.name: Extension
method.param: parent The parent node that this extension should be appended to

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes the extension from its parent.

method.name: xml
method.description: Override in order to take care of setting the Namespace and checking for containing extensions.

classRec.name: IQ
classRec.description: A class for abstraction and encapsulation of IQ (info-query) data.

method.name: IQ
method.description:
A class for abstraction and encapsulation of IQ (info-query) data.

Info/Query, or IQ, is a request-response mechanism, similar in some ways to [HTTP]. The semantics of IQ enable an entity to make a request of, and receive a response from, another entity. The data content of the request and response is defined by the namespace declaration of a direct child element of the IQ element, and the interaction is tracked by the requesting entity through use of the 'id' attribute. Thus, IQ interactions follow a common pattern of structured data exchange such as get/result or set/result (although an error may be returned in reply to a request if appropriate):

		    Requesting                 Responding
		      Entity                     Entity
		    ----------                 ----------
		        |                           |
		        | <iq type='get' id='1'>    |
		        | ------------------------> |
		        |                           |
		        | <iq type='result' id='1'> |
		        | <------------------------ |
		        |                           |
		        | <iq type='set' id='2'>    |
		        | ------------------------> |
		        |                           |
		        | <iq type='error' id='2'>  |
		        | <------------------------ |
		        |                           |
method.param: recipient The JID of the IQ recipient
iqType The type of the IQ - there are static variables declared for each type
iqID The unique ID of the IQ, one of TYPE_constants
iqCallback The function to be called when the server responds to the IQ
iqErrorCallback The function to be called when there is an error

method.name: generateID
method.description: Generates a unique ID for the stanza. ID generation is handled using a variety of mechanisms, but the default for the library uses the IncrementalGenerator.
method.param: prefix The prefix for the ID to be generated

method.name: callback
method.description:
The function that will be called when an IQ result is received with the same ID as one you send.

Callback functions take one parameter which will be the IQ instance received from the server.

This isn't a required property, but is useful if you need to respond to server responses to an IQ.

method.name: errorCallback
method.description:
The function that will be called when an IQ error is received with the same ID as one you send.

Callback functions take one parameter which will be the IQ instance received from the server.

This isn't a required property, but is useful if you need to respond to server responses to an IQ.

method.name: idGenerator
method.description: The ID generator for this stanza type. ID generators must implement the IIDGenerator interface. The XIFF library comes with a few default ID generators that have already been implemented (see org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id.. Setting the ID generator by stanza type is useful if you'd like to use different ID generation schemes for each type. For instance, messages could use the incremental ID generation scheme provided by the IncrementalGenerator class, while IQs could use the shared object ID generation scheme provided by the SOIncrementalGenerator class.
method.example:
The following sets the ID generator for the Message stanza type to an IncrementalGenerator found in org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id.IncrementalGenerator: 
Message.idGenerator = new IncrementalGenerator();

field.name: TYPE_ERROR
field.description: The stanza reports an error that has occurred regarding processing or delivery of a previously-sent get or set request.

field.name: TYPE_GET
field.description: The stanza requests information, inquires about what data is needed in order to complete further operations, etc.

field.name: TYPE_RESULT
field.description: The stanza is a response to a successful get or set request.

field.name: TYPE_SET
field.description: The stanza provides data that is needed for an operation to be completed, sets new values, replaces existing values, etc.

classRec.name: Message
classRec.description: Message, nuff said.

method.name: Message
method.description:
A class for abstraction and encapsulation of message data.

The message stanza kind can be seen as a "push" mechanism whereby one entity pushes information to another entity, similar to the communications that occur in a system such as email. All message stanzas SHOULD possess a 'to' attribute that specifies the intended recipient of the message; upon receiving such a stanza, a server SHOULD route or deliver it to the intended recipient (see Server Rules for Handling XML Stanzas (Section 10) for general routing and delivery rules related to XML stanzas).
method.param: recipient The JID of the message recipient
sender The JID of the message sender - the server should report an error if this is falsified
msgBody The message body in plain-text format
msgHTMLBody The message body in XHTML format

method.name: generateID
method.description: Generates a unique ID for the stanza. ID generation is handled using a variety of mechanisms, but the default for the library uses the IncrementalGenerator.
method.param: prefix The prefix for the ID to be generated

method.name: attention
method.description:
Messages containing an attention extension SHOULD use the headline message type to avoid offline storage. In case the attention property is used, type is set to "headline" automatically.

However there is no check for the type when removing the attention, by setting it to false.

method.name: body
method.description:
The message body in plain-text format. If a client cannot render HTML-formatted text, this text is typically used instead.

Use null to remove.

method.name: correctionId
method.description: Message ID of the message that is to be corrected.

method.name: correction
method.description: When sending a message, people often introduce typing errors and send a follow-up message to correct them. This property allows the sending client to flag the second message as correcting the first.

method.name: htmlBody
method.description:
The message body in XHTML format. Internally, this uses the XHTML data extension. TODO: Use extension registery to solve if the proper extension is enabled...

Use null to remove.

method.name: idGenerator
method.description: The ID generator for this stanza type. ID generators must implement the IIDGenerator interface. The XIFF library comes with a few default ID generators that have already been implemented (see org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id.. Setting the ID generator by stanza type is useful if you'd like to use different ID generation schemes for each type. For instance, messages could use the incremental ID generation scheme provided by the IncrementalGenerator class, while IQs could use the shared object ID generation scheme provided by the SOIncrementalGenerator class.
method.example:
The following sets the ID generator for the Message stanza type to an IncrementalGenerator found in org.igniterealtime.xiff.data.id.IncrementalGenerator: 
Message.idGenerator = new IncrementalGenerator();

method.name: receiptId
method.description:
Message ID of the message that had receipt request. Can be set only when the 'receipt' is Message.RECEIPT_RECEIVED.

While sending 'received', this property must be set to the message id that contained the 'request'.

method.name: receipt
method.description:
XEP-0184: Message Delivery Receipts

This XMPP protocol extension for message delivery receipts, whereby the sender of a message can request notification that the message has been delivered to a client controlled by the intended recipient.

method.name: state
method.description:
The chat state if any. Possible values are:
  • Message.STATE_ACTIVE
  • Message.STATE_COMPOSING
  • Message.STATE_PAUSED
  • Message.STATE_INACTIVE
  • Message.STATE_GONE

Use null to remove.

TODO: XEP states that this protocol SHOULD NOT be used with message types other than "chat" or "groupchat".

method.name: subject
method.description:
The message subject. Typically chat and groupchat-type messages do not use subjects. Rather, this is reserved for normal and headline-type messages.

Use null to remove.

method.name: thread
method.description:
The message thread ID. Threading is used to group messages of the same discussion together. The library does not perform message grouping, rather it is up to any client authors to properly perform this task.

Use null to remove.

method.name: time
method.description:
Time of the message in case of a delay. Used only for messages which were sent while user was offline.

Can be set only via XML as the value should come from the server.

There are two ways that might be possible coming from the server, XEP-0203 or XEP-0091, of which the latter is legacy.

XEP-0203: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss]TZD

XEP-0091: CCYYMMDDThh:mm:ss

field.name: NS_ATTENTION
field.description: The namespace used in the message delivery node.

field.name: NS_CORRECTION
field.description: The namespace used in the XEP-0308: Last Message Correction.

field.name: NS_RECEIPT
field.description: The namespace used in the message delivery node.

field.name: NS_STATE
field.description: The name space used in the Chat state node.

field.name: RECEIPT_RECEIVED
field.description:
Included by a receiving entity that wishes to inform the sending entity that the message has been received.

The received element SHOULD be the only child of the message stanza and MUST mirror the 'id' of the sent message.

field.name: RECEIPT_REQUEST
field.description: Included by a sending entity that wishes to know if the message has been received.

field.name: STATE_ACTIVE
field.description: User is actively participating in the chat session.

field.name: STATE_COMPOSING
field.description: User is composing a message.

field.name: STATE_GONE
field.description: User has effectively ended their participation in the chat session. Suggested delay after last activity some 10 minutes.

field.name: STATE_INACTIVE
field.description: User has not been actively participating in the chat session. Suggested delay after last activity some 2 minutes.

field.name: STATE_PAUSED
field.description: User had been composing but now has stopped. Suggested delay after last activity some 30 seconds.

field.name: TYPE_CHAT
field.description: The message is sent in the context of a one-to-one chat session. Typically a receiving client will present message of type "chat" in an interface that enables one-to-one chat between the two parties, including an appropriate conversation history. Detailed recommendations regarding one-to-one chat sessions are provided under Section 5.1. of RFC 3921 (draft version).

field.name: TYPE_ERROR
field.description: The message is generated by an entity that experiences an error in processing a message received from another entity (for details regarding stanza error syntax, refer to [xmpp-core]). A client that receives a message of type "error" SHOULD present an appropriate interface informing the sender of the nature of the error.

field.name: TYPE_GROUPCHAT
field.description: The message is sent in the context of a multi-user chat environment (similar to that of [IRC]). Typically a receiving client will present a message of type "groupchat" in an interface that enables many-to-many chat between the parties, including a roster of parties in the chatroom and an appropriate conversation history. For detailed information about XMPP-based groupchat, refer to [XEP-0045].

field.name: TYPE_HEADLINE
field.description: The message provides an alert, a notification, or other information to which no reply is expected (e.g., news headlines, sports updates, near-real-time market data, and syndicated content). Because no reply to the message is expected, typically a receiving client will present a message of type "headline" in an interface that appropriately differentiates the message from standalone messages, chat messages, or groupchat messages (e.g., by not providing the recipient with the ability to reply). The receiving server SHOULD deliver the message to all of the recipients available resources.

field.name: TYPE_NORMAL
field.description: The message is a standalone message that is sent outside the context of a one-to-one conversation or groupchat, and to which it is expected that the recipient will reply. Typically a receiving client will present a message of type "normal" in an interface that enables the recipient to reply, but without a conversation history. The default value of the type attribute is "normal".

classRec.name: Presence
classRec.description:
This class provides encapsulation for manipulation of presence data for sending and receiving.

2.2.1. Types of Presence

The 'type' attribute of a presence stanza is OPTIONAL. A presence stanza that does not possess a 'type' attribute is used to signal to the server that the sender is online and available for communication. If included, the 'type' attribute specifies a lack of availability, a request to manage a subscription to another entity's presence, a request for another entity's current presence, or an error related to a previously-sent presence stanza. If included, the 'type' attribute MUST have one of the following values:

o unavailable -- Signals that the entity is no longer available for communication.
o subscribe -- The sender wishes to subscribe to the recipient's presence.
o subscribed -- The sender has allowed the recipient to receive their presence.
o unsubscribe -- The sender is unsubscribing from another entity's presence.
o unsubscribed -- The subscription request has been denied or a previously-granted subscription has been cancelled.
o probe -- A request for an entity's current presence; SHOULD be generated only by a server on behalf of a user.
o error -- An error has occurred regarding processing or delivery of a previously-sent presence stanza.

For detailed information regarding presence semantics and the subscription model used in the context of XMPP-based instant messaging and presence applications, refer to Exchanging Presence Information (Section 5) and Managing Subscriptions (Section 6).

method.name: Presence
method.description:
According to Google Talk developers via their presentation [somewhere few years ago], most of the XMPP related traffic in their service is made by Presence.

The presence element can be seen as a basic broadcast or "publish-subscribe" mechanism, whereby multiple entities receive information about an entity to which they have subscribed (in this case, network availability information). In general, a publishing entity SHOULD send a presence stanza with no 'to' attribute, in which case the server to which the entity is connected SHOULD broadcast or multiplex that stanza to all subscribing entities. However, a publishing entity MAY also send a presence stanza with a 'to' attribute, in which case the server SHOULD route or deliver that stanza to the intended recipient. See Server Rules for Handling XML Stanzas (Section 10) for general routing and delivery rules related to XML stanzas, and [XMPP-IM] for presence-specific rules in the context of an instant messaging and presence application.
method.param: recipient The recipient of the presence, usually in the form of a JID.
sender The sender of the presence, usually in the form of a JID.
presenceType The type of presence as a string. There are predefined static variables for
showVal What to show for this presence (away, online, etc.) There are predefined static variables for
statusVal The status; usually used for the "away message."
priorityVal The priority of this presence; usually on a scale of 1-5.

method.name: priority
method.description:
The priority of the presence, usually on a scale of 1-5.

RFC: "The value MUST be an integer between -128 and +127".

If no priority is provided, a server SHOULD consider the priority to be zero.

Use NaN or 0 to remove.

method.name: show
method.description:
The show value; away, online, etc. There are predefined static variables in the Presence class for this:
  • Presence.SHOW_AWAY
  • Presence.SHOW_CHAT
  • Presence.SHOW_DND
  • Presence.SHOW_XA

Use null to remove.

method.name: status
method.description:
The status; usually used for "away messages."

The OPTIONAL status element contains XML character data specifying a natural-language description of availability status. It is normally used in conjunction with the show element to provide a detailed description of an availability state (e.g., "In a meeting"). The status element MUST NOT possess any attributes, with the exception of the 'xml:lang' attribute. Multiple instances of the status element MAY be included but only if each instance possesses an 'xml:lang' attribute with a distinct language value.

Use null to remove.

method.name: time
method.description:
Time of the presence in case of a delay. Used only for messages which were sent while user was offline.

Can be set only via XML as the value should come from the server.

There are two ways that might be possible coming from the server, XEP-0203 or XEP-0091, of which the latter is legacy.

XEP-0203: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss]TZD

XEP-0091: CCYYMMDDThh:mm:ss

field.name: SHOW_AWAY
field.description: The entity or resource is temporarily away.

field.name: SHOW_CHAT
field.description: The entity or resource is actively interested in chatting.

field.name: SHOW_DND
field.description: The entity or resource is busy (dnd = "Do Not Disturb").

field.name: SHOW_XA
field.description: The entity or resource is away for an extended period (xa = "eXtended Away").

field.name: TYPE_ERROR
field.description: An error has occurred regarding processing of a previously-sent presence stanza; if the presence stanza is of type "error", it MUST include an error child element.

field.name: TYPE_PROBE
field.description: A request for an entity's current presence; SHOULD be generated only by a server on behalf of a user.

field.name: TYPE_SUBSCRIBED
field.description: The sender has allowed the recipient to receive their presence.

field.name: TYPE_SUBSCRIBE
field.description: The sender wishes to subscribe to the recipient's presence.

field.name: TYPE_UNAVAILABLE
field.description: Signals that the entity is no longer available for communication.

field.name: TYPE_UNSUBSCRIBED
field.description: The subscription request has been denied or a previously-granted subscription has been cancelled.

field.name: TYPE_UNSUBSCRIBE
field.description: The sender is unsubscribing from the receiver's presence.

classRec.name: AbstractExtension
classRec.description: What is this?

classRec.name: SASLAuth
classRec.description: This is a base class for use with Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) mechanisms. Sub-class this class when creating new SASL mechanisms.

method.name: handleChallenge
method.description: Called when a challenge to this authentication is received.
method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.
challenge The XML of the actual authentication challenge.
method.return: The XML response to the challenge.

method.name: handleResponse
method.description: Called when a response to this authentication is received.
method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.
response The XML of the actual authentication response.
method.return: An object specifying the current state of the authentication.

method.name: request
method.description: The XML for the authentication request.

field.name: connection
field.description: Connection that is used to authenticate, if any

field.name: req
field.description: The XML of the authentication request.

field.name: response
field.description: The XML of the challenge response.

field.name: stage
field.description: The current response stage.

interfaceRec.name: ISASLAuth
interfaceRec.description: This is a base class for use with Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) mechanisms. Implement this class when creating new SASL mechanisms.

classRec.name: Anonymous
classRec.description: This class provides SASL authentication using the ANONYMOUS mechanism.

method.name: Anonymous
method.description: Creates a new Anonymous authentication object.
method.param: connection A reference to the XMPPConnection instance to use.

method.name: handleResponse
method.description: Called when a response to this authentication is received.
method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.
response The XML of the actual authentication response.
method.return: An object specifying the current state of the authentication.

classRec.name: DigestMD5
classRec.description: This class provides SASL authentication using the DIGEST-MD5 mechanism, a HTTP Digest compatible challenge-response scheme based upon MD5. DIGEST-MD5 offers a data security layer.

method.name: DigestMD5
method.description: Creates a new External authentication object.

classRec.name: XFacebookPlatform
classRec.description:
This class provides SASL authentication using the X-FACEBOOK-PLATFORM mechanism.

Facebook Chat currently supports the following features, related to authentication:

  • Facebook Platform authentication using the X-FACEBOOK-PLATFORM SASL authentication mechanism
  • Username/password authentication using the DIGEST-MD5 authentication mechanism

method.name: XFacebookPlatform
method.description: Creates a new XFacebookPlatform authentication object.
method.param: connection A reference to the XMPPConnection instance in use.

method.name: handleChallenge
method.description:
Called when a challenge to this authentication is received.

The mechanism starts with a server challenge, in the form of a common HTTP query string: an ampersand-separated sequence of equals-sign-delimited key/value pairs. The keys and values are UTF-8-encoded and URL-encoded. The query string contains two items: method and nonce.

The client's reply should be a similarly-encoded query string prepared as if it were going to call a method against the Facebook API. The call should contain the following parameters:

  • string method: Should be the same as the method specified by the server.
  • string api_key: The application key associated with the calling application.
  • string access_token: The access_token obtained in the above step.
  • float call_id: The request's sequence number.
  • string v: This must be set to 1.0 to use this version of the API.
  • string format: Optional - Ignored.
  • string cnonce: Optional - Client-selected nonce. Ignored.
  • string nonce: Should be the same as the nonce specified by the server.

The server will then respond with a success or failure message. Note that this needs to be over TLS or you'll get an error.
method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.
challenge The XML of the actual authentication challenge.
method.return: The XML response to the challenge.

method.name: handleResponse
method.description: Called when a response to this authentication is received.
method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.
response The XML of the actual authentication response.
method.return: An object specifying the current state of the authentication.

method.param: stage The current stage in the authentication process.

classRec.name: MUC
classRec.description:
This class contains a series of static constants that are used throughout the multi-user conferencing extensions.

The constants include the following for conference room affiliations:

  • AFFILIATION_ADMIN
  • AFFILIATION_MEMBER
  • AFFILIATION_NONE
  • AFFILIATION_OUTCAST
  • AFFILIATION_OWNER

And the following constants for room roles:

  • ROLE_MODERATOR
  • ROLE_NONE
  • ROLE_PARTICIPANT
  • ROLE_VISITOR

Support for the owner affiliation is REQUIRED. Support for the admin, member, and outcast affiliations is RECOMMENDED. (The "None" affiliation is the absence of an affiliation.)

classRec.name: MUCItem
classRec.description:
This class is used by the MUCExtension for internal representation of information pertaining to occupants in a multi-user conference room.

The information given inside Precense of a given room user

method.name: actorNick
method.description:
Optional. Nickname of the room user or server that made changes to the given item. Most likely when kicking someone from a room.

This property was added to Version 1.25 (2012-02-08) of the specification.

method.name: actor
method.description: Optional. JID of the room user or server that made changes to the given item. Most likely when kicking someone from a room.

method.name: affiliation
method.description: Can be one of the following: owner, admin, member, outcast, or none.

method.name: nick
method.description: The nickname of the conference occupant.

method.name: reason
method.description: Rason given by the actor for the action that was made for the given item. Most likely the reson why someone was kicked out from a room.

method.name: role
method.description: Can be one of the following: moderator, participant, visitor, or none.

classRec.name: MUCStatus
classRec.description:
XEP-0306: Extensible Status Conditions for Multi-User Chat

Traditionally, Multi-User Chat [1] has used numerical status codes similar to those used in HTTP and SMTP. Numerical codes were deprecated in the core of XMPP by RFC 3920 [2] and are no longer even defined in the core schemas provided in RFC 6120 [3] (see also Error Condition Mappings [4]). In an effort to modernize the Multi-User Chat (MUC) protocol, this document defines an extensible format for status conditions in MUC.

method.name: code
method.description: Property used to add or retrieve a status code describing the condition that occurs.

method.name: message
method.description:
Property that contains some text with a description of a condition.

One of the following values:

  • affiliation-changed
  • banned
  • configuration-changed
  • fully-anonymous
  • kicked
  • logging-disabled
  • logging-enabled
  • new-nick
  • nick-assigned
  • non-anonymous
  • realjid-public
  • removed-affiliation
  • removed-membership
  • removed-shutdown
  • room-created
  • self-presence
  • semi-anonymous
  • unavailable-not-shown
  • unavailable-shown

field.name: NS
field.description: Note that this namespace is for the message element

classRec.name: CollectionEventKind
classRec.description: The CollectionEventKind class contains constants for the valid values of the CollectionEvent class kind property.

field.name: ADD
field.description: Indicates that the collection added an item or items.

field.name: REMOVE
field.description: Indicates that the collection removed an item or items.

field.name: REPLACE
field.description: Indicates that the item at the position identified by the CollectionEvent location property has been replaced.

field.name: RESET
field.description: Indicates that the collection has changed so drastically that a reset is required.

field.name: UPDATE
field.description: Indicates that one or more items were updated within the collection. The affected item(s) are stored in the items property.

classRec.name: CollectionEvent
classRec.description: The CollectionEvent class represents an event that is dispatched when the associated collection changes.

method.name: CollectionEvent
method.description: Constructor.

field.name: COLLECTION_CHANGE
field.description: The CollectionEvent.COLLECTION_CHANGE constant defines the value of the type property of the event object for an event that is dispatched when a collection has changed.

field.name: items
field.description: When the kind is CollectionEventKind.ADD or CollectionEventKind.REMOVE the items property is an Array of added/removed items. When the kind is CollectionEventKind.REPLACE or CollectionEventKind.UPDATE the items property is an Array of PropertyChangeEvent objects with information about the items affected by the event. When a value changes, query the newValue and oldValue fields of the PropertyChangeEvent objects to find out what the old and new values were. When the kind is CollectionEventKind.REFRESH or CollectionEventKind.RESET, this array has zero length.

field.name: kind
field.description: Indicates the kind of event that occurred.

field.name: location
field.description: When the kind value is CollectionEventKind.ADD, CollectionEventKind.MOVE, CollectionEventKind.REMOVE, or CollectionEventKind.REPLACE, this property is the zero-base index in the collection of the item(s) specified in the items property.

field.name: oldLocation
field.description: When the kind value is CollectionEventKind.MOVE, this property is the zero-based index in the target collection of the previous location of the item(s) specified by the items property.

classRec.name: FormFieldType
classRec.description:
Different field types of form that can exist according to XEP-0004.

The following field types represent data "types" that are commonly exchanged between Jabber/XMPP entities. These field types are not intended to be as comprehensive as the datatypes defined in, for example, XML Schema Part 2, nor do they define user interface elements.

field.name: BOOLEAN
field.description: The field enables an entity to gather or provide an either-or choice between two options. The default value is "false".

field.name: FIXED
field.description: The field is intended for data description (e.g., human-readable text such as "section" headers) rather than data gathering or provision. The value child SHOULD NOT contain newlines (the \\n and \\r characters); instead an application SHOULD generate multiple fixed fields, each with one value child.

field.name: HIDDEN
field.description: The field is not shown to the form-submitting entity, but instead is returned with the form. The form-submitting entity SHOULD NOT modify the value of a hidden field, but MAY do so if such behavior is defined for the "using protocol".

field.name: JID_MULTI
field.description:
The field enables an entity to gather or provide multiple Jabber IDs. Each provided JID SHOULD be unique (as determined by comparison that includes application of the Nodeprep, Nameprep, and Resourceprep profiles of Stringprep as specified in XMPP Core), and duplicate JIDs MUST be ignored.

Note: Data provided for fields of type "jid-single" or "jid-multi" MUST contain one or more valid Jabber IDs, where validity is determined by the addressing rules defined in XMPP Core.

field.name: JID_SINGLE
field.description:
The field enables an entity to gather or provide a single Jabber ID.

Note: Data provided for fields of type "jid-single" or "jid-multi" MUST contain one or more valid Jabber IDs, where validity is determined by the addressing rules defined in XMPP Core.

field.name: LIST_MULTI
field.description:
The field enables an entity to gather or provide one or more options from among many. A form-submitting entity chooses one or more items from among the options presented by the form-processing entity and MUST NOT insert new options. The form-submitting entity MUST NOT modify the order of items as received from the form-processing entity, since the order of items MAY be significant.

Note: The option elements in list-multi and list-single fields MUST be unique, where uniqueness is determined by the value of the 'label' attribute and the XML character data of the value element (i.e., both must be unique).

field.name: LIST_SINGLE
field.description:
The field enables an entity to gather or provide one option from among many. A form-submitting entity chooses one item from among the options presented by the form-processing entity and MUST NOT insert new options.

Note: The option elements in list-multi and list-single fields MUST be unique, where uniqueness is determined by the value of the 'label' attribute and the XML character data of the value element (i.e., both must be unique).

field.name: TEXT_MULTI
field.description:
The field enables an entity to gather or provide multiple lines of text.

Note: Data provided for fields of type "text-multi" SHOULD NOT contain any newlines (the \\n and \\r characters). Instead, the application SHOULD split the data into multiple strings (based on the newlines inserted by the platform), then specify each string as the XML character data of a distinct value element. Similarly, an application that receives multiple value elements for a field of type "text-multi" SHOULD merge the XML character data of the value elements into one text block for presentation to a user, with each string separated by a newline character as appropriate for that platform.

field.name: TEXT_PRIVATE
field.description: The field enables an entity to gather or provide a single line or word of text, which shall be obscured in an interface (e.g., with multiple instances of the asterisk character).

field.name: TEXT_SINGLE
field.description: The field enables an entity to gather or provide a single line or word of text, which may be shown in an interface. This field type is the default and MUST be assumed if a form-submitting entity receives a field type it does not understand.

classRec.name: FormType
classRec.description: Four different types of form that can exist according to XEP-0004.

field.name: CANCEL
field.description: The form-submitting entity has cancelled submission of data to the form-processing entity.

field.name: FORM
field.description: The form-processing entity is asking the form-submitting entity to complete a form.

field.name: RESULT
field.description: The form-processing entity is returning data (e.g., search results) to the form-submitting entity, or the data is a generic data set.

field.name: SUBMIT
field.description: The form-submitting entity is submitting data to the form-processing entity. The submission MAY include fields that were not provided in the empty form, but the form-processing entity MUST ignore any fields that it does not understand.

classRec.name: AbstractJID
classRec.description:
This is a base class for the JID (Jabber Identifier) classes.

This class should not be instantiated directly, but should be subclassed instead.

It provides functionality to determine if a JID is valid, as well as extract the node, domain and resource from the JID.

The structure of JID is defined in RFC3920:

  • jid = [ node "@" ] domain [ "/" resource ]
  • domain = fqdn / address-literal
  • fqdn = (sub-domain 1"." sub-domain))
  • sub-domain = (internationalized domain label)
  • address-literal = IPv4address / IPv6address

method.name: AbstractJID
method.description:
Creates a new AbstractJID object. Used via EscapedJID or UnescapedJID.

Each allowable portion of a JID (node identifier, domain identifier, and resource identifier) MUST NOT be more than 1023 bytes in length, resulting in a maximum total size (including the @ and / separators) of 3071 bytes.
method.param: inJID The JID as a String.
validate True if the JID should be validated.

method.name: escapedNode
method.description: Provides functionality to convert a JID to an escaped format.
method.return: The escaped string. TODO: simplify with native methods

method.name: toString
method.description: Converts JID represented by this class to a String.

method.name: unescapedNode
method.description: Provides functionality to return an escaped JID into a normal String.

method.name: bareJID
method.description: The JID without the resource.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain portion of the JID.

method.name: node
method.description: The node portion of the JID.

method.name: resource
method.description: The resource portion of the JID.

classRec.name: Browser
classRec.description:
XEP-0030: Service Discovery

This class provides a means of querying for available services on an XMPP server using the Disco protocol extension. For more information on Disco, take a look at XEP-0030 and XEP-0011 (obsolete) for the protocol enhancement specifications.

method.name: Browser

method.param: aConnection A reference to the XMPPConnection instance to use.

method.description: Use the OBSOLETE BrowseExtension (jabber:iq:browse namespace) to query a resource for supported features and children.
method.param: id The full JabberID to query for service items
callback The callback function to call when results are retrieved
errorCallback The callback function to call when errors are received

method.name: getServiceInfo
method.description: Retrieves a list of available service information from the server specified. On successful query, the callback specified will be called and passed a single parameter containing a reference to an IQ containing the query results.
method.param: server The server to query for available service information
callback The callback function to call when results are retrieved
errorCallback The callback function to call when errors are received

method.name: getServiceItems
method.description: Retrieves a list of available services items from the server specified. Items include things such as available transports and user directories. On successful query, the callback specified in the will be called and passed a single parameter containing the query results.
method.param: server The server to query for service items
callback The callback function to call when results are retrieved
errorCallback The callback function to call when errors are received
